00021 #include "util/PgOptions.h"
00022 #include "util/RegressionCheck.h"
00023 #include "util/TextFileCheck.h"
00024 #include "util/Util.h"
00025 #include "util/Verbose.h"
00026 //
00027 #include <cstdlib>
00028 #include <cstring>
00029 #include <iostream>
00030 #include <string>
00031 
00032 using namespace std;
00033 const int passed = 0;
00034 const int failed = 1;
00035 
00036 int main(int argc, char* argv[])
00037 {
00038   try {
00039 
00040     //If no arguments given
00041     if(argc == 0) 
00042       {
00043         cout<<"Error: Incorrect number of arguments passed to Matrix Check"<<endl;
00044         return failed;
00045       } 
00046     else 
00047       {
00048         PgOptions* opts = new PgOptions();
00049       
00050         //Set Usage message for Text File Check
00051         opts->setUsage("\n\n*****apt-check-textfile Help*****");
00052       
00053         //Define acceptable Command Line arguments for apt-check-textfile
00054         opts->defineOption("h", "help", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00055                            "A bool value, answer true if you want help!",
00056                            "false");            
00057         opts->defineOption("g", "gold", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00058                            "A String representing the Gold file to check against - the perfect/reference file",
00059                            "");
00060         opts->defineOption("n", "gen", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00061                            "A String representing the Generated File to check - the test file",
00062                            "");
00063         opts->defineOption("s", "skipLines", PgOpt::INT_OPT,
00064                            "An integer that signifies the number of lines to skip before comparing",
00065                            "0");
00066         opts->defineOption("v", "expectedRetVal", PgOpt::INT_OPT,
00067                            "An integer value representing the desired return value used to flag a positive or negative test.  0 is positive, 1 is negative",
00068                            "0");
00069         opts->defineOption("t", "testName", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00070                            "Name of the Test being Run",
00071                            "");
00072 
00073         //Parse argv and store it within PgOptions class variables
00074         //Match the command line arguments to the proper options
00075         opts->parseArgv(argv);
00076 
00077         //DEBUG
00078         //opts->dump();
00079 
00080         if(opts->getBool("help") == true)
00081           {
00082             opts->usage();
00083             return passed;
00084           }
00085 
00086         std::string gen;
00087         std::string gold;
00088         if(opts->get("gen") != "")
00089           {
00090             gen = opts->get("gen");
00091           }
00092         else
00093           {
00094             cout<<"Error: No value for Generated File (gen) given.  Exiting"<<endl;
00095             return failed;
00096           }
00097 
00098         if(opts->get("gold") != "")
00099           {
00100             gold = opts->get("gold");
00101           }
00102         else
00103           {
00104             cout<<"Error: No value for Gold File (gold) given.  Exiting"<<endl;
00105             return failed;
00106           }
00107 
00108         //Store variable values
00109         int skipLines = opts->getInt("skipLines");
00110         int expectedRetVal = opts->getInt("expectedRetVal");
00111         std::string testName = opts->get("testName");
00112 
00113         //Run Check
00114         TextFileCheck* tCheck;
00115         tCheck = new TextFileCheck(gen, gold, skipLines);
00116         std::string errorMsg = "";
00117         bool pass =  tCheck->check(errorMsg);
00118 
00119         //Test for Regular Pass (Positive)
00120         if(expectedRetVal == 0)
00121           {
00122             if(!pass)
00123               {
00124                 cout<<"Error in " + testName + "(): " + errorMsg<<endl;
00125                 cout<<"Error: Failed Text File Check"<<endl;
00126                 return failed;
00127               }
00128             else
00129               {
00130                 cout<<"Passed Text File Check"<<endl;
00131                 return passed;
00132               } 
00133           }
00134         //Test for Negative
00135         else
00136           {
00137             if(pass)
00138               {
00139                 cout<<"Error in " + testName + "(): " + errorMsg<<endl;
00140                 cout<<"Error: Failed Text File Check"<<endl;
00141                 return failed;
00142               }
00143             else
00144               {
00145                 cout<<"Passed Text File Check"<<endl;
00146                 return passed;
00147               } 
00148           }
00149       }
00150   } 
00151   catch(...) 
00152     {
00153       Verbose::out(1,"Unexpected Error: uncaught exception.");
00154       return failed;
00155     }
00156   return failed;
00157 }
